result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristy K Egner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Payment Plan: $50.00/mo commencing on December 1, 2016.
Clerk to pay out restitution to victim.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kristy K Egner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: commitment amount posted in Stevens Point
of Warrant cancellation -Commitment balance posted in Stevens Point PD
Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Kristy K Egner in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that the defendant has paid Restitution to the COC office this morning.  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Atty Hendee asks that the court order the restitution to be paid out to the victim.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Restitution Surcharge = $37.90
COC office to pay out Restitution to the victim

  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing on December 1, 2016

Final pre-trial on October 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on November 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kristy K Egner in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that a Not Guilty plea has already been entered and asks for a trial date.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Trial  Jury trial scheduled for November 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Authorization to Appear
SPD - Mark Gums
Return date on July 20, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Kristy K Egner
Current: 617 John's Drive #5, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 05-19-2016)
Prior: 1080A S. Chicago Ln, Friendship, WI 53934

Pre-trial conference on April 12, 2016 at 09:15 am.
Return date on May 19, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Kristy K Egner in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.

  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.
  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking today

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions the defendant.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.    Court finds waiver made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return & Pre-Trial

  Return date scheduled for May 19, 2016 at 03:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 09:15 am.
